line.words: El Gran Monstruo Murcielago. Por Dave Waddell.

subtitle.line: The Great Bat Monster. By Dave Waddell.
The Great Bat Monster. By Dave Waddell.

line.words: La feria ha llegado al pueblo de Alfredo.

subtitle.line: The fair has come to Alfredo’s town.
The fair has come to Alfredo’s town.

line.words: Alfredo había estado soñando con esta feria. En su sueño había un monorriel, que llevaba a todos a donde quisieran ir.

subtitle.line: Alfredo has been dreaming of the fair. In his dream there was a monorail. It took everyone where they wanted to go.
Alfredo has been dreaming of the fair. In his dream there was a monorail. It took everyone where they wanted to go.

line.words: Había payasos, una Rueda de la Fortuna, un carrusel, resbaladillas, juegos mecánicos, carritos chocones, una montaña rusa y otras cosas de ferias. En su sueño Alfredo se subía al tren fantasma. Era el mejor.

subtitle.line: There were clowns, a Big Wheel, a merry-go-round, slides, rides, bumper cars, a roller coaster and lots of other fair things. In his dream Alfredo went on the ghost train. It was the best.
There were clowns, a Big Wheel, a merry-go-round, slides, rides, bumper cars, a roller coaster and lots of other fair things. In his dream Alfredo went on the ghost train. It was the best.

line.words: Alfredo está más emocionado que un pez en el agua.

subtitle.line: Alfredo is more excited than a fish in water.
Alfredo is more excited than a fish in water.

line.words: Alfredo y su mamá van a la feria. §No puedo esperar más.§ dice Alfredo. §Ni yo.§ dice la mamá de Alfredo.

subtitle.line: Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum go to the fair. “I can’t wait,” says Alfredo. “Neither can I,” says Alfredo’s Mum.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum go to the fair. “I can’t wait,” says Alfredo. “Neither can I,” says Alfredo’s Mum.

line.words: §Voy a subirme al tren fantasma.§ dice Alfredo. §Yo también.§ dice la mamá de Alfredo.

subtitle.line: ‘‘I’m going to go on the ghost train,” says Alfredo.“Me too,” says Alfredo’s Mum.
‘‘I’m going to go on the ghost train,” says Alfredo.“Me too,” says Alfredo’s Mum.

line.words: §Apuesto a que hay una calaca.§ dice Alfredo. §Y un búho.§ dice su mamá. §Y un lobo, y puertas azotándose, y cadenas, ratas y arañas.§

subtitle.line: “I bet there’s a skeleton,’ says Alfredo.“And an owl,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “And a wolf, and slamming doors, and chains, rats and spiders.§
“I bet there’s a skeleton,’ says Alfredo.“And an owl,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “And a wolf, and slamming doors, and chains, rats and spiders.§

line.words: §Cuando era chiquita me subí al tren fantasma y vi a un Gran Monstruo Murciélago y lo escuché susurrando palabras malvadas.§ Esto no le gustó a Alfredo.

subtitle.line: §When I was little, I went on a ghost train. I saw the Great Bat Monster. I heard it whisper evil words.” This annoys Alfredo.
§When I was little, I went on a ghost train. I saw the Great Bat Monster. I heard it whisper evil words.” This annoys Alfredo.

line.words: §No es cierto.§ él dice, §No viste un Gran Monstruo Murciélago. No estaba a tu alrededor cuando tú eras chiquita.§ §Sí estaba. Responde la tía Pat, yo tenía 10 años y ella 9. Tenía la edad mínima y fuimos juntas.§

subtitle.line: “You did not,” he says. “You did not see the Great Bat Monster. It was not around when you were little. ’‘It was. Ask Auntie Pat. I was 10 years old. She was the minimum age. She was 9. We went together.“

“You did not,” he says. “You did not see the Great Bat Monster. It was not around when you were little. ’‘It was. Ask Auntie Pat. I was 10 years old. She was the minimum age. She was 9. We went together.“

line.words: §No es cierto.§ dice Alfredo, su sangre está hirviendo.

subtitle.line: “Not true,” says Alfredo. His blood is boiling.
“Not true,” says Alfredo. His blood is boiling.

line.words: §Es verdad,§ dice la mamá de Alfredo, §Todavía tengo el boleto. Un boleto costaba 50 centavos. También, sólo medíamos un poco más de un metro, la estatura mínima. Había una estatura mínima en esos tiempos.§

subtitle.line: “It is,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “I still have the ticket. One ticket cost 50 pence. Also, we were just over one metre tall - the minimum height. There was a minimum height in those days.”
“It is,” says Alfredo’s Mum. “I still have the ticket. One ticket cost 50 pence. Also, we were just over one metre tall - the minimum height. There was a minimum height in those days.”

line.words: §No es cierto§ dice Alfredo, §Y no había un Gran Montruo Murcielago.§

subtitle.line: “There was not,” says Alfredo, “and the Great Bat Monster was not either.”
“There was not,” says Alfredo, “and the Great Bat Monster was not either.”

line.words: Alfredo y su mama dejaron de hablar. Ya casi llegan a la feria. La visita a la feria no se parece al sueño de Alfredo.

subtitle.line: Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum stop talking to each other. They are nearly at the fair. This visit to the fair is nothing like Alfredo’s dream.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum stop talking to each other. They are nearly at the fair. This visit to the fair is nothing like Alfredo’s dream.

line.words: Cuando llegan a la feria, no es ahí. Sólo hay un campo vacío y una viejita está sentada en el pasto.

subtitle.line: When they get to the fair, it is not there. It is just a field. An old woman is sitting on the grass.
When they get to the fair, it is not there. It is just a field. An old woman is sitting on the grass.

line.words: §¿Disculpe?§ pregunta la mamá de Alfredo. §,pero… ¿Dónde está la feria?§ §¿La feria?§ contesta la viejita. §La feria fue la semana pasada, cariño.§ §¿Había un tren fantasma?§ pregunta Alfredo.

subtitle.line: “Excuse me,” says Alfredo’s Mum, ‘but where is the fair?” “Fair?” says the old woman. “The fair was last week, my dear.” “Did it have a ghost train?” says Alfredo.
“Excuse me,” says Alfredo’s Mum, ‘but where is the fair?” “Fair?” says the old woman. “The fair was last week, my dear.” “Did it have a ghost train?” says Alfredo.

line.words: §Sí, cariño,§ responde la viejita, §pero no estaba el Gran Monstruo Murciélago. A mi me encanta, me acuerdo cuando era chiquita...§

subtitle.line: “Yes, dear,” says the old lady. “But no Great Bat Monster. I love the Great Bat Monster. I remember when I was little…”
“Yes, dear,” says the old lady. “But no Great Bat Monster. I love the Great Bat Monster. I remember when I was little…”

line.words: La viejita habló sobre los Grandes Monstruos Murciélagos de sus tiempos.

subtitle.line: The old lady talks about some of the Great Bat Monsters of her youth.
The old lady talks about some of the Great Bat Monsters of her youth.

line.words: La mamá de Alfredo no dijo nada.

subtitle.line: Alfredo’s Mum does not say anything.
Alfredo’s Mum does not say anything.

line.words: Alfredo no dijo nada.

subtitle.line: Alfredo does not say anything.
Alfredo does not say anything.

line.words: La viejita terminó de hablar y se fue. La mamá de Alfredo y Alfredo se sentaron en el pasto.

subtitle.line: The old woman finishes talking. She goes. Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum sit on the grass.
The old woman finishes talking. She goes. Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum sit on the grass.

line.words: §¿Ma?§ dice Alfredo. §¿Sí?§ contesta su mamá. §¿Sabes? Cuando fuiste con mi tía Pat a la feria...§ §¿Sí?§ dice la mamá de Alfredo. §Y viste al Gran Monstruo Murciélago...§ §¿Sí?§ dice la mamá de Alfredo. §¿Cómo era?§

subtitle.line: “Mum?” says Alfredo. “Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum. “You know when you went to the fair with Auntie Pat?” “Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum. “And you saw the Great Bat Monster?” “Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum. “What did it look like?”

“Mum?” says Alfredo. “Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum. “You know when you went to the fair with Auntie Pat?” “Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum. “And you saw the Great Bat Monster?” “Yes?” says Alfredo’s Mum. “What did it look like?”

line.words: —Bueno… —dice su mamá y le cuenta a Alfredo sobre el mejor Gran Monstruo Murciélago que ha existido.

subtitle.line: “Well,” says Alfredo’s Mum, and tells Alfredo all about the greatest Great Bat Monster that ever lived.
“Well,” says Alfredo’s Mum, and tells Alfredo all about the greatest Great Bat Monster that ever lived.
The end.
